data.title: Comments on 24 Hour Party People — Daniel Boone Regional Library
data.meta_description: Explore Daniel Boone Regional Library. New titles, recently rated, and recently tagged by the library community.
data.text:
WittyPenguin rated this title 4 out of 5 stars

Wonderfully inventive film about the birth of independent music from Manchester. Joy Division, New Order, Happy Mondays; they’re all here, along with the rise and fall of either the genius or stupidity of Factory Records. Brilliant.

RoyalJellyIII rated this title 3 out of 5 stars

Its wit and sense of fun open it up to people with only a passing interest in the music and the era.

ba_library rated this title 1 out of 5 stars

Very dull which is too bad since Manchester spawned great bands like Joy Division, New Order, Blue Mondays during the late 1970s. Unfortunately, the DVD focuses on Tony Wilson (played by Steve Coogan) who was a journalist that discovered…

Isley rated this title 3.5 out of 5 stars

As a chronicle of a music scene I don’t know much about (except that Joy Division is awesome) a lot of the details from this one are lost on me. Still, this is a fresh take on the biopic/”rise and fall of a scene” type of movie that is…
